title: eu-central-1: Only Virtual MFA is enabled for root
description:
**Issue:** eu-central-1: Only Virtual MFA is enabled for root
**Control:** Ensure hardware MFA is enabled for the root account
**AWS Account:** 012345678912 | **Region:** eu-central-1
**CIS Control:** 1.14
**Prowler check:** check114
**AWS Service:** iam
**ASFF Compliance Type:** Software and Configuration Checks
**Security Domain:** IAM
mitigation: Using IAM console navigate to Dashboard and expand Activate MFA on your root account.
impact: The root account is the most privileged user in an AWS account. MFA adds an extra layer of protection on top of a user name and password. With MFA enabled when a user signs in to an AWS website they will be prompted for their user name and password as well as for an authentication code from their AWS MFA device. For Level 2 it is recommended that the root account be protected with a hardware MFA.

title: eu-central-1: Cluster control plane access is not restricted for EKS cluster prod
description:
**Issue:** eu-central-1: Cluster control plane access is not restricted for EKS cluster prod
**Control:** Restrict Access to the EKS Control Plane Endpoint
**AWS Account:** 012345678912 | **Region:** eu-central-1
**CIS Control:** 7.96
**Prowler check:** extra796
**AWS Service:** eks
**ASFF Compliance Type:** Software and Configuration Checks
**Security Domain:** Infrastructure Security
mitigation: You should enable private access to the Kubernetes API server so that all communication between your nodes and the API server stays within your VPC. You can limit the IP addresses that can access your API server from the internet; or completely disable internet access to the API server.
impact: By default; this API server endpoint is public to the internet; and access to the API server is secured using a combination of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) and native Kubernetes Role Based Access Control (RBAC).

title: eu-central-1: Control plane logging is not enabled for EKS cluster prod
description:
**Issue:** eu-central-1: Control plane logging is not enabled for EKS cluster prod
**Control:** Ensure EKS Control Plane Audit Logging is enabled for all log types
**AWS Account:** 012345678912 | **Region:** eu-central-1
**CIS Control:** 7.94
**Prowler check:** extra794
**AWS Service:** eks
**ASFF Compliance Type:** Software and Configuration Checks
**Security Domain:** Logging and Monitoring
mitigation: Make sure you logging for EKS control plane is enabled.
impact: If logs are not enabled; monitoring of service use and threat analysis is not possible.

title: eu-central-1: prod.config_read.iam has inline policy directly attached
description:
**Issue:** eu-central-1: prod.config_read.iam has inline policy directly attached
**Control:** Ensure IAM policies are attached only to groups or roles
**AWS Account:** 012345678912 | **Region:** eu-central-1
**CIS Control:** 1.16
**Prowler check:** check116
**AWS Service:** iam
**ASFF Compliance Type:** ens-op.acc.3.aws.iam.1
**Security Domain:** IAM
mitigation: Remove any policy attached directly to the user. Use groups or roles instead.
impact: By default IAM users; groups; and roles have no access to AWS resources. IAM policies are the means by which privileges are granted to users; groups; or roles. It is recommended that IAM policies be applied directly to groups and roles but not users. Assigning privileges at the group or role level reduces the complexity of access management as the number of users grow. Reducing access management complexity may in-turn reduce opportunity for a principal to inadvertently receive or retain excessive privileges.
